bill_title: deduct the fees or commissions charged by real estate  firms, agents, or brokers when using the market approach to determine full and true value of property.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to deduct the fees or commissions charged by real estate firms, agents, or brokers when using the market approach to determine full and true value of property. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 7-9 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The register of deeds shall subtract the fees or commissions charged by any real estate firm, agent, salesperson, or broker and the value of personal property from the actual consideration exchanged for the real property to obtain the adjusted price for real estate listed in the certificate of value form required pursuant to § 7-9-7. Section 2. That chapter 10-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The director of equalization shall use the adjusted price for real estate as defined in section 1 of this Act when using the market approach to determine true and full value of any property. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
